channel.title: NYT > Style
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 The New York Times Company

item.title: Judi Jupiter, a 76-Year-Old Social Media Star, Is Gen Z at Heart
item.description: In the 1970s, she photographed Andy Warhol and Debbie Harry on wild nights at Studio 54. Now she’s chronicling a new generation.
item.dc:creator: Alex Vadukul

item.title: Were Kylie Jenner and Timothée Chalamet’s Matching ‘Marty Supreme’ Looks Style or Strategy?
item.description: Does the couple that dresses together stay together? A coordinated look on a “Marty Supreme” red carpet brought back memories of double denim and matching haircuts.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lang
item.media:credit: Frederic J. Brown/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Timothée Chalamet and Kylie Jenner wore matching outfits at the Los Angeles premiere of “Marty Supreme,” a film that Mr. Chalamet produced and starred in.

item.title: How Can I Stop My Wife From Badgering Our Friends About Climate Change?
item.description: A reader’s wife is angry about what she sees as insufficient commitment to the cause of environmentalism, alienating the couple’s friends.
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes

item.title: At the Kennedy Center Honors, Little Glitz and One Striking Accessory
item.description: Melania Trump went minimal, Gloria Gaynor dressed to shine, but the star of the night was the president.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Valerie Plesch for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump and the first lady, Melania Trump, arriving for the Kennedy Center Honors on Sunday.

item.title: The 67 Most Stylish People of 2025
item.description: They appeared on courts and carpets, stages and sidelines, screens big and small. And they all shaped notions of style and self-expression.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

item.title: How Sarah Sherman of ‘SNL’ Plans to Make Audiences Squirm in New HBO Special
item.description: In her debut comedy special, the “S.N.L.” cast member takes her love of the grotesque to theatrical proportions. You may want a barf bag.
item.dc:creator: Callie Holtermann and Alexandra Genova
item.media:credit: Alexandra Genova for The New York Times

item.title: Is Jennifer Welch the Democrats’ Toughest Critic?
item.description: The reality TV celebrity turned left-wing podcaster Jennifer Welch is fed up with President Trump. She also expects better from the Democrats.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Hess
item.media:credit: Danielle Amy for The New York Times
item.media:description: Jennifer Welch co-hosts the podcast “I’ve Had It,” where she brings on guests like Rahm Emanuel and Hakeem Jeffries and doesn’t let them off the hook.

item.title: What Trump’s East Wing Demolition Says About Our Preoccupation With ‘Renovation’
item.description: The gutting of the East Wing of the White House and our national preoccupation with “renovation.”
item.dc:creator: Rhonda Garelick
item.media:description: Our preoccupation with renovations goes beyond architecture.

item.title: Why It’s Best to Imagine the Worst
item.description: After learning devastating news about our young son, we needed to feel connected to friends and family, not just exist beyond their imagination.
item.dc:creator: Tanmeet Sethi

item.title: They Run a Grocery Store Together. Now They’re Walking Down the Aisle.
item.description: Gretty Garcia and Jesse Clemente left full-time jobs in advertising and journalism to help with one of her parents’ businesses in the Bronx.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lang

item.title: She’s in Gaza. He’s in Cairo. Separated by a Closed Border, They Married Remotely.
item.description: Mayar Kabaja and Hatem Saadallah went on their first date in Gaza City 10 days before Oct. 7, 2023. He and his family evacuated to Egypt over 18 months ago, and the two have not been able to see each other since.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan
item.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
item.media:description: Mayar Kabaja and Hatem Saadallah were married on Oct. 27. Unable to reunite until the Rafah border crossing reopens, they were wed in a ceremony that took place with a power of attorney and Mr. Saadallah on the phone.

item.title: Two Scots Choose a Wintry New York for a Would-Be Elopement
item.description: Lauren Aitchison and Tommy Kerr made a marriage plan shortly after falling in love in Glasgow, but her mother was soon on to them.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: He Fell in Love With the Video Game-Themed Artwork, Then the Artist
item.description: Hector Perez admired Adrianny Almonte’s mural in Santo Domingo, but he didn’t know she had painted it until he stumbled on a Facebook post.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘He Invited Me In for a Glass of Wine’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: Bezel-Set Engagement Rings: A Quiet Luxury Accessory
item.description: Bezel settings, like the one featured in Taylor Swift’s engagement ring, “feel elegant and intentional,” one designer said. “There’s no noise.”
item.dc:creator: Sara Radin
item.media:description: An increasing number of the soon-to-be-betrothed have been gravitating toward bezel-set rings.

item.title: Wendy Osefo Is Among the Latest ‘Real Housewives’ Stars in Legal Trouble
item.description: Osefo, of “The Real Housewives of Potomac,” faces several counts of fraud. She is the latest in a long line of “Housewives” personalities to face legal trouble.
item.dc:creator: Johnny Diaz
item.media:description: Wendy Osefo of “The Real Housewives of Potomac” and her husband, Edward Osefo, were indicted on fraud charges in October.

item.title: Jessie Buckley is a Grieving Mother in Hamnet
item.description: Jessie Buckley, star of “Hamnet,” on the primal love — and grief — of motherhood.
item.dc:creator: Anna Martin, Reva Goldberg, Emily Lang, Davis Land, Christina Djossa, Amy Pearl, Sara Curtis, Elisa Gutierrez, Jen Poyant, Lynn Levy, Daniel Ramirez and Dan Powell
item.media:credit: Photo Illustration by The New York Times; Background: Brian Rea; Inset photo: Chris Pizzello/Invision, via Associated Press

item.title: Some Teens Are on Social Media ‘Almost Constantly,’ Survey Says
item.description: The new Pew report also found that two-thirds of teens said they had used an A.I. chatbot.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Pearson

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: Archival Garments
item.description: A pair strolling through Tokyo were dressed in outfits that incorporated special and sentimental pieces.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: These Travel Influencers Don’t Want Freebies. They’re A.I.
item.description: Social media posts by A.I.-created travel avatars cost far less to produce, yet look and sound real. Human influencers worry they’re being elbowed out.
item.dc:creator: Julie Weed

item.title: I Let Reddit Choose My Wedding Dress — and They Got It Right
item.description: It can be easier to talk to strangers, which might explain why Reddit has become an increasingly popular resource for wedding planning.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Diamond
item.media:credit: Irena Rudovska/iStock; Thomas Fuller/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images; Illustration by The New York Times

item.title: The Most Stylish People of 2025
item.description: Journalists from the New York Times Styles desk give their picks for the most stylish people of 2025.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk, Edward Vega, Chevaz Clarke and Stephanie Swart

item.title: With MaXhosa Africa, Laduma Ngxokolo Is Reweaving South Africa’s Story
item.description: Laduma Ngxokolo, the designer behind MaXhosa Africa, is on a mission to embrace his country’s history and traditions, rather than hide from them.
item.dc:creator: Yola Mzizi
item.media:description: Laduma Ngxokolo founded MaXhosa Africa in 2010, basing the label’s offerings on traditional Xhosa patterns and motifs, but reimagined for the modern world.

item.title: Francis Ford Coppola’s F.P. Journe Sells for $11 Million at Auction
item.description: Frenzied bidding pushed the polarizing F.P. Journe timepiece into near-record territory despite one dealer calling the design “goofy.”
item.dc:creator: Jacob Bernstein

item.title: Pam Hogg, Clothes Designer Who Went to Extremes, Dies at 74
item.description: She was a star of London’s post-punk D.I.Y. fashion, art and performance scene, and dressed a generation of rock stars in her otherworldly handmade clothes.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green
item.media:description: Pam Hogg in 2010. She refused to alter her vision or be influenced by market forces. “I’m giving them what they don’t know they want,” she told the BBC.

item.title: How to Save Money on Your Wedding With Budgeting Tips From Married Couples
item.description: From skipping a professional florist in favor of store-bought flowers to swapping a formal dinner for a food truck, newlyweds share tips that kept their budgets intact.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan

item.title: Why Are Weddings So Expensive?
item.description: There’s no getting around it: Weddings can be pricey. Here’s a breakdown of the costs.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Manners
item.media:credit: Alex Welsh for The New York Times

item.title: Melissa McCarthy, the Cast of ‘S.N.L.’ and more Attend American Museum of Natural History Gala
item.description: It was all gratitude for the prehistoric beasts that once roamed the earth at the American Museum of Natural History gala in New York.
item.dc:creator: Alex Vadukul
item.media:credit: Krista Schlueter for The New York Times

item.title: Frank Gehry, Titan of Architecture, Is Dead at 96
item.description: He designed some of the world’s most recognizable buildings, notably the spectacular Guggenheim Museum Bilbao, his masterpiece.
item.dc:creator: Nicolai Ouroussoff
item.media:description: Frank Gehry en 2003, en una ceremonia de inauguración de la Sala de Conciertos Walt Disney de Los Ángeles, uno de los muchos edificios célebres que diseñó en todo el mundo.

item.title: Versace Announces Dario Vitale’s Shocking Departure
item.description: After one hit collection, the designer Dario Vitale will be leaving the brand. What’s going on?
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman

item.title: Dashing Through a Season of Holiday Movies
item.description: For one writer, putting together her annual roundup of streaming holiday movies requires open-mindedness — and a high tolerance for candy-coated clichés.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr
